author: RK Yoo
text:
"Guy here was so funny. Hello tell you what's what and what he likes to eat. Came here with friends Sunday night after dinner and only cakes/tarts left. Figure we would give it a try.

Best thing I've had in a while.  Everything was delicious. Nothing was too sickly sweet. Nothing was bland. Everything was fresh and the cream was so light I thought the baker plucked clouds from the sky. Yum!

Highly recommend apple pie/tart for fresh apples
column5: walnut cream cake
column6: deliciously creamy and slightly salty to balance your sweet and finally the strawberry cream cake to brighten your day. Will definitely come back to try other desserts!"

author: Phillipp Schmoll
text: "I can't say enough about this place. I lived in Germany for 10 years and I know a thing or two about German bread. I have never found another bakery that even comes close to this one. They are the real deal

column6: like the Quarkb√§llchen (Donut balls) that are crack-ish! Don't forget to try the cakes and strudels - they're amazing!!"

author: Lisa Sivo
text: "The owner is very helpful and courteous and if you go when he is working the counter
column5: all should be good. The woman who worked there this morning
column6: however
column7: made me consider not returning (though i probably will
column8: as German bakeries are few and far between in NNJ.) I'd already eaten breakfast there and walked to the counter. She'd suggested that I try a pastry. I said I was interested in the br√∂tchen and stood in front of them
column9: ready to purchase a couple of the pumpkin seed variety. Her friend sitting at a table said something to her in Spanish and all of a sudden she took the 4 pumpkin seed ones away and said they were for someone else. I could tell she felt weird saying it
column10: but she did it anyway. I mumbled something about them being on display and available
column11: but then just decided to be civil and not make a fuss. I couldn't help feeling that it was no way to treat a customer."

text: 'This is one of my favorite places in Hoboken. The breads are great. I live around the corner and usually get a half loaf of either the onion bread

column7: and the bread remind me of home.  I also like the hard boiled egg breakfast sandwich.\n\nPro tip: if there is something specific you want I suggest either coming early (especially on weekends) or call ahead and they‚Äôll be happy to hold it for you. It‚Äôs baked fresh every day so while they try to make enough for demand

author: george drake
text: 'We are from Ct. My wife and I spotted the bakery yesterday afternoon as we were about to return home from Hoboken and stopped for a cup of coffee and something sweet to go with it. It was a GREAT choice. We left with a loaf of Onion bread and 7 grain bread. Tried them both this morning. VERY happy we chose to buy the bread - they are delicious!  We are only unhappy that live so far away.'

author: Hauke Vagts
text: 'Amazing bread and excellent cakes.  Pre-ordering is recommended.'

author: Agharza F. Malikov
text: 'Liked everything
column5: from desserts to ambiance. The owners are super nice.'

author: spoorthi Shres
text: 'Delicious carrot cake'

author: Arman Istepanyan
text: 'Very good sandwiches'

author: Bernd S.
text: "Well what shall I say
column5: finally
column6: finally a German bakery that deserves the name! Got the crusty bread and yes you have to have teath to eat
column7: and that's how it is supposed to be. Beside that the bread tastes great. The cake
column8: some real German variations. Can only say if you like German bakery products this is the place to go! Keep it up over there

author: Kristiyan Georgiev
text: 'Make sure you ask about the price before you buy it. German mouse had and cherry German cake were very generic
column5: nothing close to a rich German chocolate. Stay away from the deserts here.'

text: 'Great place to have a coffe and some pie!'

author: Daniel Sin
text: 'Pear&chocolate strudel and the house blend coffee are really good!'

author: Dan Vinakovsky
text: 'Nice place to sit and have dessert or coffee.'

author: Esra Ileri
text: "Amazingly delicious desserts
column5: sandwiches and coffee. The best customer service in Hoboken. Once you enter
column6: you feel like you're in Germany. Can't get enough of this place :)"

author: Omar Elissa
text: 'Absolutely amazing pastries and cakes.'

author: Mariela Fuentes
text: 'I love it there üòÅ'

author: Harald Vagts
text: '(Translated by Google) A great tasting bread. Every time we come to Hoboken on holiday every year
column5: we are happy to get such a loaf.\nIncidentally
column6:
the rolls taste very good as well.

Ein super schmeckendes Brot. Immer wenn wir jedes Jahr in Urlaub nach Hoboken kommen
column7: sind wir gl√ºcklich so ein Brot zu bekommen.\nDie Br√∂tchen schmecken √ºbrigens auch sehr gut.'

author: zena safar
text: 'The best place for sweeties !!!'

author: prashanth r
text: 'I like their coffee..'

author: M Fink (Mac Cortez)
text: 'Great food'

author: Sam Kopolovich
text: 'Awesome desserts from Germany. Delicious coffee.'

author: Alexander Shapiro
text: 'Amazing coffee served just as in Europe
column5: not paper cups
column6: which makes all the difference in the world!'

author: Alexander Ushakov
text: 'Bought 3 cakes tonight. Did not like any of them.'

author: Alexander Witzel
text: 'I\'m German and I like the typical dark
column5: crusty German bread. After three month of looking for something at least similar I finally found the Old German Bakery and I\'m happy now! The bread is perfect - it smells delicious
column6: and tastes just great. Real German bread made in Hoboken.\n\nBy the way the "Apfelstrudel" is also delicious!'

author: Stella Troiano
text: 'Their pastries are delicious
column5: especially their almond and chocolate and apple strudel is out of this world. We stop by in the morning on our way to work.'

author: Nicole D'onofrio
text: 'I am the pickiest person when it comes to coffee
column5: because I drink it black! German bakery does coffee right! They always take their time making it and make it right in front of me and it comes out tasting absolutely perfect. It reminds me of the coffee I used to have in Europe. I have been living in Hoboken for 5 years
column6: and they have the best coffee here
column7: in my opinion. The owner always greets me
column8: even if he is busy and asks how me and my husband are doing. Even if I am walking down the street
column11: is super sweet and works so hard. I love all of their pastries too and they are a good size to split
column12: as well. Everything has always tasted so fresh and it amazes me how many things they can make each day and how fast it all goes. I go to this bakery probably three times a week for coffee and it is such a special experience. This place is a gem!'

author: Susanne Wirth
text: 'Pricey but worth every penny!!!!'

author: Keagan Aaron
text: 'The best pastries I had in a while! This is my new breakfast spot! Very courteous staff as well!'

author: Anil Nirgudkar
text: 'Fantastic breads
column5: Coffee
column6: and deserts.Love it.'

author: subrata saha
text: 'Limited items on menu. But quality is good. Pastries not too sweet & soft.'

author: ◊§◊ú◊ï◊†◊ô ◊ê◊ú ◊û◊ï◊†◊ô
text: 'Great coffee
column5: gorgeous desserts!'

author: Anastasia E.
text: "I've been coming to this bakery for two years already
column5: and I just love it. That's the best bakery in the neighborhood! The cherry strudel
column6: apple pie and cakes are out of this world
column7: all breads are amazing! Thank you!!"

author: Alexander Yezutov
text: 'It is a wonderful place my wife and I like a lot. Very delicious deserts to end a nice Sunday day.'

author: John Hill
text: "best coffee I've had in a looooong time"

author: Li Shan Kwan
text: 'Quark ball is yummy
column5: so does apple strudel. The staff is friendly too.'

author: Deepti Kalra
text: "I ordered pastries from here for my husband's surprise birthday party and have been a fan ever since. These are by far the best I have had in a long time :)"

author: Dawn Riedel
text: 'Hands down THEE best pastries in Hoboken!!!! Sorry to say but shopped both at this one and Carlo"s Bakery and the Old German Bakery\'s quality and taste surpassed the Cake Boss hype... And the counter staff here was friendly and took the time to descibe everything in their glass case
column5: and didn\'t treat us like a herd of cattle.  Will return here for our next visit to the area.'

author: Shweta Singh
text: 'Best Bakery ever.'

author: Ryszard Siembida (M&R Foto)
text: "Happy 3 anniversary\nI have been coming here ALMOST everyday for about 3 years I am a very picky coffee drinker and VERY picky with my pastries
column5: as well as customer service. I gave this 5 stars because I love the tranquility
column6: EXCELLENT personal customer service
column8: I buy large everytime and have had pear chocolate
column13: mango cream cake...My advice is this: please do NOT come in here with a snobby
column14: snap your finger attitude-go to Dunkin Donuts or Starbucks for that because there may be a wait. . Thank you so much for the owner's kindness/warmth and the staff's personable touch and again having kind souls! In such a fast paced
column16: this place is worth my time and my hard earned money!"

author: Maria NS
text: "I went on a baked-goods-buying rampage yesterday.  It started at Carlo's Bakery.  I had never bought anything there and wanted to see if it lived up to the hype.  I didn't expect it to
column5: and it doesn't.  However
column6: on my way to buy coffee
column7: I passed this little gem and couldn't help but buy something (more pastries!).  I would like to pass out flyers to all of those poor benighted fools standing in line at Carlo's
column8: telling them they are at the wrong bakery.  The Old German Bakery was amazing
column9: much better than anything you'll get at Carlo's.  At the Old German Bakery
column10: you won't have to stand in line for two hours and your pastry will actually be fresh and made out of good quality ingredients....all for a better price tag.  It is a win
column15: and I suspect the pastries may actually be authentically German.  I don't know enough about the subject matter to say for certain
column16: but the product is convincing.  Don't worry. You can still take your picture in front of Carlo's.  I won't tell anyone you didn't buy anything there."

author: Kathleen Soule Lambert
text: 'Best coffee
column5: excellent sandwiches (and soup
column6: soon)
column7: wide variety of pastries from not so sweet to sweet
column8: as well as cakes. My favorite nosh place!'

author: Amir H. Sadoughi
text: 'Good cakes.'
